intro: Leucophrys mesocoma, commonly known as the white-leaved mesocoma, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, whitish coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
